metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8457 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
SQLite3 from 3.6.0 to and including 3.27.2 is vulnerable to heap out-of-bound read in the rtreenode() function when handling invalid rtree tables.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8457` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

db5.3-sql-util - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
db5.3-util - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3 - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3++ - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3-java - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3-java-jni - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3-sql - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3-stl - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
libdb5.3-tcl - 5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.27.2-3
libsqlite3-0 - 3.27.2-3
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.27.2-3
sqlite3 - 3.27.2-3
sqlite3-tools - 3.27.2-3
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> db5.3 has a sqlite into /lang/sql/sqlite

criterions.comment: db5.3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.3.28+dfsg1-0.6ubuntu1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
sqlcipher package in jammy is affected and needs fixing.
sqlite3 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.27.2-3').
